meanings.definition: A point where two or more things are joined
meanings.sent1: At the junction of the two rivers, the water flows together.
meanings.sent2: The junction of the puzzle pieces created a complete picture.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally glued my fingers together at the junction.
meanings.sent4: The junction of our ideas led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The junction of the train tracks was a busy and important spot.

meanings.definition: A place where roads or railway lines meet and cross
meanings.sent1: The traffic light at the junction turned red, signaling us to stop.
meanings.sent2: The junction of Main Street and Elm Street is always busy during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: I got lost at the junction and ended up taking a detour.
meanings.sent4: The junction of the train tracks resembled a complex maze from above.
meanings.sent5: The junction where the highways intersect is known for its traffic jams.

meanings.definition: The action or fact of joining or being joined
meanings.sent1: The junction of the two pieces was seamless, showing expert craftsmanship.
meanings.sent2: The junction of the two teams resulted in a powerful collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The junction of the two wires created a spark of electricity.
meanings.sent4: The junction of the two paths symbolized unity and togetherness.
meanings.sent5: The junction of the two hands in a handshake signified agreement and friendship.
